title: [K-12] Advanced Socio-Medical Policy Analysis through Anemia Case-based Problem-solving Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental medical terminology, understanding of public health systems, and ability to interpret statistical data
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment using digital devices, ensuring dedicated team discussion spaces

learning_goals: Learners analyze anemia case studies to explain the impact of socioeconomic factors on disease management.
Learners enhance their ability to interpret medical data and write policy proposals through team-based collaboration.

Learners can select one community health issue (e.g., infectious disease prevention, nutritional imbalance) using a hybrid model combining PBL (Problem-Based Learning) and TBL (Team-Based Learning). They can write a project report structured in three stages (problem definition → solution design → implementation planning) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on peer and teacher evaluations (5-point scale).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
